dialogues.speaker: Aunty
dialogues.text: Hello, kids!

dialogues.speaker: Aunty
dialogues.text: I'm Mimi Mausi! I'm here to tell you about the city of Haridwar!

dialogues.speaker: Aunty
dialogues.text: Like you've read in the book, Haridwar along with Ujjain, Nashik and Prayagraj (Allahabad) is one of four sites where drops of Amrit, the elixir of immortality accidentally spilled over from the pitcher while being carried by the celestial bird Garuda.

dialogues.speaker: Aunty
dialogues.text: Can you find my friend Baba in this picture of Haridwar?

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: Nice work finding me, kids!

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: Centuries ago, when Hindus visited the holy town of Haridwar, they used to go to the Pandit in charge of one's family register and update the family tree with details of all marriages, births, and deaths from ones extended joint family.

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: I'm Baba, one of those Pandits. This is a tradition kept alive and honoured by people like me.

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: In modern India, when people visit Haridwar, many of them are confused by us asking them for details.

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: I prefer, as do most Pandas, for people to come prepared after getting in touch with all of the one's extended family,

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: and bringing all relevant details regarding one's ancestral district and village, names of grandparents and great grandparents and marriages, births and deaths that have occurred in the family.

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: This is our sacred profession and we, as keepers of history, take great pride in it.

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: Bye now!

dialogues.speaker: Aunty
dialogues.text: Why did you let Baba go, child? Now who'll tell you about the Ganga Aarti?

dialogues.speaker: Aunty
dialogues.text: You'd better go find him again!

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, did you need me for something else?

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: Hmm. The Ganga Aarti. Sure, I'll tell you about it!

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: Ganga Aarti is the major attraction of this place. It's breathtaking in person.

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: The lights and shadows, the mantras and just the aura of the place paint a picture of an exotic dreamland.

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: We do this everyday at dusk to honour and cherish Mother Ganga, from whose lap life springs.

dialogues.speaker: Baba
dialogues.text: Off you go, kiddo! Find someone else to pester. A shopkeeper, maybe?
